Text: Marco Belinelli hit a go-ahead fadeaway jumper with three seconds remaining in overtime, as the Chicago Bulls escaped the TD Garden with a hard fought 100-99 victory over the Boston Celtics. Richard Hamilton had a team-high 20 points for the visitors, who led by as many as 10, but had to battle back from a late deficit in regulation and overtime to overcome a season-high 30 points from Rajon Rondo. It was the third straight win overall for the Bulls, while the Celtics dropped the final two games over their five-game homestand.
